content.description: Good sit start, two big moves lead to the top.  Start on twin crimps below a square flake/crimp thing.  Pull up to the flake with your right hand, match, then pull hard and make the big move up and left to a flat jug, top out.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter to help keep you off the tree.
content.location: On the right side of the boulder, about five feet right of Nosey Heart arete.

content.description: Same sit start as "Nosey Heart", on good crimps located towards the bottom of the right Arete. Climb up about 5 feet and rock over to the slab on your left. Top out the slab.
content.location: To the right of the hardest slab route. Sit start on obvious crimps on the right Arete. See topo photo.

content.description: Sit start and climb the blunt arete up and slightly right.  Fun.
content.location: Lower Heart boulder, just down the hill and through the woods from Heart of Glass.  The arete in the middle of the boulder.

content.description: Sit as for static heart. Move to the block then right onto the face with a small pinch. Finish up and right
Start standing at the left Arete. Work your way up the Arete using what you can find for feet. Very fun climbing.
Climb the slab just right of the crack. The crack is off. Originally climbed in Royal Robins
content.location: The steep slab facing the road, just right of the crack.

content.description: Start way on right of boulder, traverse left as for Cold Shoulder but at the break continue left using crimp and pocket to gain the jug of Static Heart.  Harder than it looks.

Start sitting as for Nosy Heart but move right (but not all the way right to the Static Heart hold) after the first good holds on the arete to the face and make a big move to the flat jug of Static Heart from small holds.  Kind of contrived but fun.

Do Directly Direct, but sit start. Those with flexible legs (and short legs) may find the start easier. Those with long legs may find the transition into directly direct easier once they stand up. Probably been done before. I decided it was worthy of it's own page.
content.protection: Pad for your butt when you biff the start, pad or two for the top when your foot picks off and you come shrieking down
content.location: The steep slab of lower heart. I started right hand on a good hold, left on an okay sloper

content.description: Tricky, technical and tenuous. It will probably spit you off a few times. Climb up the middle of the very steep slab face. You will need some finger skin and good footwork for this. Usually done from a stand start, though an awkward sit start can be added  if you wish; no grade bump
content.protection: Pad. The landing is good, but a spot is nice for the thin top.
content.location: The middle of the very steep slab facing the road

content.description: Start way right and traverse left on obvious holds to the break then topout through the break.
Across the swamp from the Heart, this is the left boulder.  Left side has some good slab problems and the right side is slightly overhanging.
